issues.description: The problem specification and UML refer to a static method calculateTotalPrice(Meal) in SealSaloon, but both the template Main and solution SealSaloon define a static method computeMealCost(Meal) instead. This name mismatch will confuse students and cause automated tests expecting calculateTotalPrice to fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the computeMealCost method in both the template and solution to calculateTotalPrice to match the problem description and UML, or alternatively update the problem statement and UML to refer to computeMealCost instead.

issues.description: The problem statement defines a method named `calculateTotalPrice(Meal)` in `SealSaloon` to compute the net cost of a meal, but both the solution implementation and the sample calls in the templateâ€™s `Main.java` use a method named `computeMealCost(Meal)` instead. This mismatch forces students to translate between `calculateTotalPrice` (in the spec) and `computeMealCost` (in code), adding unnecessary cognitive load.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename `computeMealCost(Meal)` (and all its calls) in both the template and solution to `calculateTotalPrice(Meal)` so that the code identifier matches the method name specified in the problem statement.
